name: Tunes & Tales: Miriyam Wilson & Kesha Christie
description:
Embark on a colourful journey every Friday at Old City Hall, where musicians perform from the grand staircase and storytellers fill the council chamber with lively tales that celebrate Toronto's vibrant cultural mosaic. Enjoy soulful tunes, festive melodies and stirring stories with a global flavour that capture the magic of the season. 

This event features uplifting steelpan performances by Miriyam Wilson and storytelling by Kesha Christie, who brings stories to life with warmth, insight and unforgettable energy.

name: Fresh Market
description: Fresh Market increases access to high-quality, culturally-relevant, and affordable produce in neighbourhoods where it is often unavailable.

name: Illumination at Todmorden Mills
description: Enjoy enhanced holiday tours featuring period decorations in the historic houses, which showcase celebrations from the 1890s and 1940s. Visitors can participate in a rotation of themed crafts and games inspired by various traditions. This event focuses on the common threads of light, warmth, and family encouraging visitors to experience the museum as a place of warmth, connection, and personal meaning-making.

name: Winter Blooms: Circus at the Garden
description:
Get ready for a one-of-a-kind immersive experience at the Garden with intimate indoor and outdoor performance locations featuring Toronto's top aerial artists.

Experience thrilling, touching, and funny performances as aerialists, acrobats, jugglers, and clowns bring heart-warming winter tales to life. 

This enchanting show celebrates the spirit of the season, the turning of the year, and the magic that happens when friends gather to share stories under the winter sky. Perfect for families and anyone who loves circus, nature, and a touch of seasonal magic!

Suitable for all ages, you are welcome to meet the cast after the show!

name: Bandura on Bloor Christmas Special
description:
Returning for a final time this year! 

Featuring Ukrainian-Canadian bandura duet Banduralicious with performances from the Bandura Trio and a young rising star, Solomia Shevchuk!

This is a musical concert series in Toronto showcasing solo performers, small ensembles and bands featuring the bandura. Join us for this delightful opportunity to enjoy this magical sound!

This performance will be followed by a post-concert Christmas-themed reception for all the guests and performers.

Partial net proceeds from this concert will sponsor scholarships to the Litnia Zustrich Bandura Camp for Ukrainian children who have recently moved to Canada due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

name: Fresh Produce Market
description: Fresh Produce Market increases access to high-quality, culturally-relevant, and affordable produce in neighbourhoods where it is often unavailable.

name: Caribbean Christmas Village | Little Jamaica

address.streetAddress: 1817 Eglinton Avenue West 1815 Eglinton Avenue West, 2370 Dufferin St, ON M6E 2H7

description:
Six days of Caribbean vibes, eats, music, and gifts—bringing island spirit right to Eglinton West!  The Village Marketplace is packed with holiday gifts from Black and Caribbean creators—think books, candles, crafts, beauty treats, and unique stocking stuffers for every last-minute shopper.

Craving a taste of the islands? The Taste the Caribbean Food Sampling Hub serves up a rotating menu of traditional dishes, first-come, first-served:
• Opening Night: Caribbean "Cocoa Tea." 
• Pepperpot Soup
• Haitian Soup Joumou
• Caribbean Cornmeal Porridge
• Rum Cake
Special guest "Kente Claus"—the Caribbean holiday icon—brings extra sparkle to Little Jamaica!

All week, reggae bands and steel pan artists will fill the plaza with infectious Caribbean rhythms. Full program schedule on our website.

Do not forget to dress for the winter weather!

name: Lox Rutz live at DROM Taberna
description: Mexican Psychedelic Rhythms band based in Toronto.

name: Caribbean Christmas Village
description:
Watch as Little Jamaica comes alive this holiday season! 

Enjoy a celebration of Caribbean culture, food, music, and holiday shopping — set to transform the newFairbank LRT Station Plaza into a vibrant winter marketplace. Tiny wooden vendor cabins and touches of the Caribbean will add to the ambience of this exciting new space.

This is a new cultural highlight for the city, created by community advocate and cultural producer Lori Beazer. This high-impact event brings together local vendors, artists, culinary talent, and families to celebrate the spirit of the islands right in the heart of Eglinton West.

name: Orbital Ensemble live at DROM Taberna
description:
A multicultural band that fuses vintage Brazilian tones with modern psychedelic and jazz influences, creating an immersive and eclectic sound. With a seamless blend of dynamic grooves, soaring melodies and explosive soundscapes, the group offers listeners a fresh and engaging musical journey.

Rooted in Brazilian rhythms and keen to explore new sonic territories, Orbital Ensemble has a unique take on fusion music with a bold, contemporary approach. A brainchild of Brazilian Composer and guitarist Felipe Sena, the band features Toronto jazz heavy-hitters and a variety of instruments such as flute and saxophone, drums and bass, Brazilian percussion, nylon guitar, keys and fuzzed-out electric guitar.

name: ROM After Dark: Winter Festivals of Light
description:
Spark that holiday joy.   

Join us for a special winter edition of ROM After Dark. Enjoy tons of live performances, selfie stations, DJ sets spinning everything from disco to city pop, and playful roaming acts that pop up throughout the night. It will be a memorable evening to experience ROM in a whole new glow!

name: Adam Beer-Colacino live at DROM Taberna
description: Sweet and Swampy Soul. Getting up into the clouds and beyond with Lowell Whitty on Drums and Tom Richards on Sousaphone.
